poem:
Boiler Room Blues

In Burgess Park, a whisper rides  
on concrete walls,  
spray-paint shout  
of fractured rhythms.  
Torn beats dance  
on divided grounds—  
sound held hostage  
by whispered wars.  
Here, between strides of  
light and shadow,  
muffled echoes ask  
how far notes travel  
on lines drawn  
by conflicted hands.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
